title: Megathon
description: Annual 24‑hour hackathon focused on entrepreneurial innovation and real-world problem solving.
Attractive prize pool: ₹400,000 in 2023 (≈ 4 L INR), ₹250,000 for select problem winners in 2024.
Features industry-backed problem statements, mentorship, certificates and networking opportunities.

title: Smart India Hackathon
description: National hackathon by MoE to solve real-world challenges from government and industry.
Winning teams receive ₹1.5L per problem statement.
Includes mentorship by experts, implementation support by sponsoring organizations, and opportunity to pitch solutions to stakeholders.

title: Hedera Africa Hackathon
description: Pan-African blockchain hackathon building innovative dApps using the Hedera network.
Over $60,000 in total prizes across multiple tracks including DeFi, SocialFi, AI, and Sustainability.
Includes mentorship, grant opportunities, and global exposure via DoraHacks and Hedera ecosystem.

title: NASA Space Apps Challenge Noida
description: Local edition of NASA’s global Space Apps Challenge—India’s Noida hub for Oct 4‑5, 2025.
Annual event using NASA open data to solve real-world Earth & space problems.
No registration fee; global recognition for submissions across hundreds of local hubs.

title: Odoo x CGC Mohali Hackathon
description: 24‑hour coding competition at CGC Mohali built on the Odoo platform.
Top teams win prize money (~₹105,000) and internships.
Final round held on August 30‑31, 2025 with regional visibility.

title: ETHGlobal New York
description: Major blockchain hackathon with global participation and large sponsor support.
Prize pool of around $225,000 across tracks including DeFi and L2 scaling.
Scheduled August 15‑17, 2025, open to all skill levels.

title: ETHGlobal New Delhi
description: ETHGlobal’s New Delhi edition, open for blockchain builders worldwide.
Prize pool around $175,000 across categories like smart contracts and NFTs.
Runs September 26–28, 2025 at a premier tech venue.

title: GovHack 2025
description: Australia and New Zealand’s largest civic hackathon using open government data.
Participation via local hubs across cities in Sep 2025.
Winners recognized at national Red Carpet Awards, prize tiers vary.
